unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Conditions for Two-Way Tables
question_text:
Which of the statements is/are true concerning conditions for chi-squared procedures involving two-way tables?

I. Data must come from a random sample or random samples.
II. Expected counts must all be greater than $1$, and no more than $20\%$ of expected counts can be less than $5$.
III. $np$ and $n(1-p)$ must both be greater than $5$ where $n$ is the number of trials and $p$ is the proportion of successes.
solution:
Statements I and II are true; these are the conditions necessary for a chi-squared procedure involving two-way tables.

Statement III is false; this is a necessary condition for a test involving a single proportion, not chi-squared procedures.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
